snippet: When floodwaters from Tropical Storm Irene slammed a historic Vermont diner in 2o11, its owners thought that was the end of the story. But it had just started.
abstract: Wilmington Journal; historic Dot's Restaurant in Wilmington, Vt, was saturated by flood waters after Tropical Storm Irene in August, 2011, but rebuilds and reopens; patrons were not prepared to let local institution disappear; fund-raising, donations of labor and materials and tax credits help owners Patty and John Reagan refurbish diner but leave them $400,000 in debt.
lead_paragraph: When floodwaters from Tropical Storm Irene slammed a historic Vermont diner in 2o11, its owners thought that was the end of the story. But it had just started.

headline.main: In Vermont, a Town That Would Not Let Its Diner Go
headline.print_headline: The Town That Would Not Let Its Diner Go
